title.narrative: (906.1) CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: All children affected by migration have their rights protected, respected and fulfilled. Selected COs are supported with preparedness and capacity to respond in a timely and adequate manner to the needs of children affected by migration in Europe and Central Asia., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ALL MIGRANT AND REFUGEE CHILDREN , UASC or with their families, benefit from timely, equitable, quality access to services to guarantee their protection, care, development and social inclusion in ITALY (2018-2019)

sector.narrative: Protective services for children on the move

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: All children affected by migration have their rights protected, respected and fulfilled. Selected COs are supported withpreparedness and capacity to respond in a timely and adequate manner to the needs of children affected by migration in Europe andCentral Asia.

description.narrative: Through child protection programme, UNICEF reached 5,319 children and 1,116 frontline workers and caregivers. During 2021 UNICEF strengthen partnerships with key National Ministries as part of EU Child Guarantee programme, becoming a recognized and reliable stakeholder providing technical support. UNICEF continued programming in the areas of alternative care, guardianship system and MHPSS with regards to migrant and refugee children.;The programme mixed a short-term emergency approach and a more long-term one, through service provision, advocacy, evidence-generation, modelling interventions, capacity building and technical support both at national and local level.;The inter-agency CP coordination system was strengthened, particularly with UNHCR. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/04/2022
